supporting_text: The NAP mentions specific actions in the human health sector, including improving awareness of AMR amongst the general public and professionals.
The NAP includes actions related to animal health, such as establishing a national AMR surveillance system that integrates animal health.
The NAP mentions the need for environmental surveillance for AMR in various settings, including hospitals and animal production units.
The NAP addresses agricultural practices and the use of antimicrobials in food production sectors.
The NAP outlines the roles and responsibilities of the National AMR Coordinating Centre (NACC) to monitor and evaluate the implementation of different strategic interventions.
The NAP specifies that by 2022, a national early warning system will be in place to identify the emergence of resistance in priority pathogens.
The document mentions that detailed planning along with the budget allotted for the respective activities will be done in due course by national stakeholders.
The NAP establishes a National Multi-Sectoral Steering Committee (NMSC) for antimicrobial resistance.
The NAP includes plans to revise curricula in undergraduate medical and veterinary education to incorporate AMR and related topics.
The NAP outlines plans for nationwide evidence-based awareness campaigns targeting the general public and professionals.
The NAP mentions collaboration with WHO, FAO, and OIE for technical support in various activities.
The NAP includes establishing a national AMR surveillance system and building laboratory capacity for high-quality microbiological data.
The NAP aims to develop a national early warning system to identify the emergence of resistance in priority pathogens.
The NAP includes objectives related to establishing a national infection prevention and control programme.
The NAP mentions the need to develop guidelines for AMR surveillance, incorporating standards from OIE and WHO.
The NAP includes the development of an essential medicines list with special reference to the use of antimicrobial agents.
The NAP outlines the need for a National AMR Containment and Use Policy and related regulatory frameworks.
The NAP includes plans for a comprehensive evidence-based formal antimicrobial stewardship programme at the national level.
The NAP envisions collaborations with national and international agencies for the implementation of a strategic research agenda.
